New Records: Cade Smith set a new MLB record for a reliever in a division series with 12 strikeouts.
Steven Kwan became the first Cleveland player and third in MLB history to collect three hits or more in three straight postseason games.
Kwan's 11 hits in the ALDS are a new club record for a single division series.
Kwan’s 20 hits are the most by a Cleveland player through 12 career playoff games.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the fifth inning, made possible by Kwan’s one-out base hit off Skubal.
The game was a decisive victory for the Guardians, allowing them to advance to the ALCS against the Yankees.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager A.J. Hinch praised Smith for the volume of work that he produced throughout the series and his ability to remain at a high level through all five outings.
Post-Match Reflections: Smith said he is not taking a second of the experience for granted.
Kwan said the extra rest between the end of the regular season and the playoff opener last week and his time on the injured list in September also helped his performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Progressive Field in Cleveland, Ohio.
The Guardians will open the American League Championship Series against the Yankees in Yankee Stadium on Monday.
